pullRequest.body:
The existing theorem `IsPurelyInseparable.injective_comp_algebraMap` says that if E/F is purely inseparable, then every RingHom from F to a reduced commutative ring L lifts in at most one way to E. This PR shows if L is a perfect field, then such a RingHom always lifts to E, and also add AlgHom versions. For this purpose we slightly generalize `natSepDegree_map` and deduce `PerfectField.splits_of_natSepDegree_eq_one`.

Also add theorem `Field.Emb.cardinal_separableClosure` saying that the F-embeddings of an algebraic extension E/F are equipotent with F-embeddings of `separableClosure F E`.

Since `Algebra.IsAlgebraic` is now a class, two theorems are made instances.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7e09755aba](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18811/commits/7e09755aba0481d91fc2079ddc667a635bf66369)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Field.Emb.cardinal_separableClosure`
`+ PerfectField.splits_of_natSepDegree_eq_one`
`+ bijective_comp_algebraMap`
`+ bijective_restrictDomain`
`+ injective_comp_algebraMap`
`+ injective_restrictDomain`
`+ instance [Field L] [PerfectField L] [Algebra F L] : Nonempty (E →ₐ[F] L)`
`- IsPurelyInseparable.injective_comp_algebraMap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1319cc1e-dff9-4af9-920e-00ac47e5f39b) for commit b559fb5c8dd7c4c36b42167109a210483c8e095b.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/6472c384-e9cd-462f-b8f2-c0f372ad374b/to/1319cc1e-dff9-4af9-920e-00ac47e5f39b) against commit b696b3524d2dde1068fa8192e92f25c990e9eb15.

> Looks good to me. Are there other results referring these two explicitly? Maybe they can be just `inferInstance` now.

Good point! There are two uses of one theorem and one use of the other, and another in #9480.
I plan to finish all TODOs in `Mathlib/FieldTheory/PurelyInseparable.lean` in PR #18770. Currently there are only one remaining. Can you check if they will conflict with your PR?

> I plan to finish all TODOs in `Mathlib/FieldTheory/PurelyInseparable.lean` in PR #18770. Currently there are only one remaining. Can you check if they will conflict with your PR?

I don't see any conflicts. Everything in this PR is rather trivial, while the TODOs are not.
Looks good to me. Are there other results referring these two explicitly? Maybe they can be just `inferInstance` now.
Looks good to me. Are there other results referring these two explicitly? Maybe they can be just `inferInstance` now.
I think maybe `fun f : E →ₐ[R] L ↦ f.comp (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R F E)` is almost the same as `AlgHom.restrictDomain`.

I think now the order of variables in the definition of `AlgHom.restrictDomain` is not well arranged, which causes a subtle difference between it and `fun f : E →ₐ[R] L ↦ f.comp (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R F E)`. Therefore, maybe order of variables in the definition of `AlgHom.restrictDomain` should be changed, so that we could directly write `AlgHom.restrictDomain` here.
I changed the order. Thank you!

pullRequest.title: feat: lifting Ring/AlgHom to purely inseparable extension
